column4: sorry if i barge in, but can you briefly explain the problem?
sudo make gives me 225 errors when installing ndiswrapper.
http://pastebin.com/m42f7166
did you install by alternate/have internet now?
I do not have internet on the laptop with the problems.
can you temporary get internet on it? jack a cable in?
billy: I've tried it before and I didn't get any kind of connection.
did what, jack a able in?
Yes.
I just took the ethernet out from the router and put it into my laptop.
don't unjack the router, that's the end where the other cable goes in
The router is hooked up to the modem, though? billy: Yes.
don't unjack the router. Unjack the desktop and use that one. Plug a cable from your laptop to the router.
Let me look at the cables. . .
I'm not sure what I should be looking for. . .
you should be looking for a cable that goes from your laptop to your router, and not use the cable that goes between your router and modem.
There is no cable from my laptop to the router.
i'm asking you to put a cable there.
it's to be able to install the packages needed to compile ndiswrapper
And that cable is originally hooked up to the desktop, correct.
then unjack the desktop and plug it on the router please
Okay, I have found it.
billy: Okay, I'm unplugging now. . .
once your laptop is online, install xchat and come back here please
precede with sudo.
sudo aptitude install pastebinit ""
==> cat /etc/apt/sources.list | pastebinit (provide link in channel please)
you have to update it ... system -> administration -> update manager. From there select check and then run the previous command again please.
you fixed the network issue?
Yes.
good to hear
Ubuntu is making me cry. T_T
why :(
Lots of problems. =|
give me an overview then
errors?
My screen resolution isn't fixed yet.
My sound is messed up now (worse than before).
the screen resolution is due to not having restricted drivers.
I enabled the restricted drivers and I restarted for something and now it's back to normal.
After I enabled the restricted drivers, it worked.
good
explain sound screwed up?
No volume control GStreamer plugins and/or devices found.
Okay, I have two things in my Restricted Drivers Manager -- both are enabled but neither are in use.
i c. you might have to compile alsa for that
which are enabled?
How do I do that?
we'll come to that later
first answer bazhang who asked for your sources.list :-)
Lucent/Agere linmodem controller driver and NVIDIA accelerated graphics driver (latest cards).
How do I get my sources.list?
cat /etc/apt/sources.list
bazhang: http://pastebin.com/d6cb07b4
i can see you did follow my suggestion, however you forgot a few. line 6, 8,13,15
so ==> sudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list and edit those lines =)
Okay, I saved.
then update :-)
Update?
sudo apt-get update
BUT ONLY if you have internet on it now
I'm talking to you from the laptop.
Okay, it updated.
good. a sec
for easy use, i'll write you a script and tell you how to run it
Run what? =D
the script that i'm writing right nwo
That does what?
hopefully fix your sound
Okay, I see.
It says there are 129 updates available. . .
while you update i'll write your script then
Why are there so many updates?
because you haven't updated properly last night. You forgot the 2 sources that had the most updates.
Oh.
Was it last night?
I've lost track of time. o_O
for me it was, i just woke up
Everything has become a continuous blur of Ubuntu. =_=
Oh, it's well past midnight here.
copy this script into an empty file ==> http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/61987/
How do I get an empty file? =D
alright, in terminal type ==> gedit sound.sh
Yes. Then?
copy the text in, save it, then close it. type this ==> chmod +x sound.sh
Okay, done.
once you're done updating (don't break it off, just let it continue first) run this ==> ./sound.sh
that'll download the latest sources, copy them to the right folder, extract them, compile them, and then remove the unneeded stuff.
Okay, it's about 3/4ths of the way through applying the changes.
Wow, okay. Thanks.
then after that you can execute the script :)
i'm off for breakfast now, we'll talk later k?
Execute the script. . .
Yes, sure.
==> ./sound.sh (ask bazhang if you're lost)
Okay, thanks.
Hi? =D
What?
